data.title: Eric Clapton Eric Clapton - Remastered - Anniversary Edition UK Vinyl LP
data.meta_description: ERIC CLAPTON Eric Clapton (2021 Anniversary Edition UK/EU 11-track black vinyl LP, Eric's eponymous 1970 album now remastered by Miles Showell at Abbey Road Studios. This album marked Clapton's transition from flamboyant instrumental icon to well-rounded recording artist, downplaying sonic pyrotechnics in favour of a song-focused ensemble approach. For the occasion, he surrounded himself with a new cast of American musicians, tapping into a rootsy musical foundation that pro Tracklisting & Info: This summer sees the Anniversary Deluxe Edition of Eric Clapton's eponymous first solo album, originally released in August 1970. It is being issued on 4CD and 1LP (standard black) formats. The album represents one of rock history's most successful reinventions. After emerging as one of the seminal guitar heroes of the '60s, the English superstar decisively re-established his musical priorities with Eric Clapton. It marked Clapton's transition from flamboyant instrumental icon to well-rounded recording artist, downplaying sonic pyrotechnics in favour of a song-focused ensemble approach that would lay the groundwork for his massively successful solo career. For the occasion, he surrounded himself with a new cast of American musicians, tapping into a rootsy musical foundation that provided an inspired framework for his talents. ERIC CLAPTON Eric Clapton (2021 Anniversary Edition UK/EU 11-track black vinyl LP, Eric's eponymous 1970 album now remastered by Miles Showell at Abbey Road Studios. This album marked Clapton's transition from flamboyant instrumental icon to well-rounded recording artist, downplaying sonic pyrotechnics in favour of a song-focused ensemble approach. For the occasion, he surrounded himself with a new cast of American musicians, tapping into a rootsy musical foundation that provided an inspired framework for his talents. With replica Polydor red lables and picture sleeve, factory sealed)

TRACKLISTING AND EXTRA INFORMATION

This summer sees the Anniversary Deluxe Edition of Eric Clapton's eponymous first solo album, originally released in August 1970. It is being issued on 4CD and 1LP (standard black) formats.

The album represents one of rock history's most successful reinventions. After emerging as one of the seminal guitar heroes of the '60s, the English superstar decisively re-established his musical priorities with Eric Clapton. It marked Clapton's transition from flamboyant instrumental icon to well-rounded recording artist, downplaying sonic pyrotechnics in favour of a song-focused ensemble approach that would lay the groundwork for his massively successful solo career. For the occasion, he surrounded himself with a new cast of American musicians, tapping into a rootsy musical foundation that provided an inspired framework for his talents.
